more. So you might have to be 
patient. Remember, feeding 
is an opportunity to feel close 
to your baby and get to know 
them. Even when your baby is 
a little older, they should never 
be left alone to feed with a 
propped-up bottle, as they 
may choke. You should check 
regularly that teats are not 
torn or damaged.
When feeding, make sure 
you keep the teat full of milk, 
otherwise your baby will take 
in air and get wind. If the teat 
becomes	flattened	while	you
